articles.title: Spokesman for DPRK FM Lays Bare Reactionary, Dangerous Nature of Obama's Asian Junket
articles.content:
Spokesman for DPRK FM Lays Bare Reactionary, Dangerous Nature of Obama's Asian Junket
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry issued the following statement on Monday:
					 It is reported that U.S. President Obama is to tour Asia soon. Pursuant to the U.S. pivot to Asia-Pacific strategy, his projected trip is a reactionary and dangerous one as it is aimed to escalate confrontation and bring dark clouds of a nuclear arms race to hang over this unstable region. 
					
					 This strategy which the Obama administration adopted under the signboard of "rebalancing" in the Asia-Pacific region late in 2011 is, in essence, designed to focus efforts on this region in a bid to encircle and contain its rivals and maintain its political and military edge.
					
					 The U.S. is citing the DPRK's "nuclear and missile threats" and "provocation" as a pretext for hiding the hegemonic nature of the above-said strategy and warding off the resistance of big countries in Eurasia. 
					
					 "The Quadrennial Defense Review Report" announced by the U.S. Department of Defense early in March took issue with the DPRK over its "provocation" and "threat", reconfirming that the U.S. would deploy 60 percent of its naval force in the Asia-Pacific region till 2020, pursuant to the "strategy for rebalancing in the Asia-Pacific region". During his recent trip to a neighboring country, the U.S. secretary of Defense announced that the U.S. would additionally deploy two Aegis in Japan till 2017, citing "invasion" from the DPRK.
					
					 Touring south Korea and China in mid-February, the U.S. secretary of State vociferated about the DPRK's promotion of nuclear development and possible "provocation" while blustering that the U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises would be staged in the same period and by the same method in the future, too, regardless of the crucial proposal made by the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and the north-south high-level contact.
					
					 It is as clear as noonday that Obama will trumpet about the same thing to accuse the DPRK this time, too, just as he habitually did in the past.
					
					 Clear is the reason why the U.S. is ceaselessly staging extremely offensive and aggressive joint military exercises in south Korea only among various areas in the Asia-Pacific region and steadily increasing their number and scale in a bid to deliberately keep the vicious cycle of tensions. Its aim is to steadily rattle the nerves of the DPRK and compel it to bolster up its nuclear deterrence, take military retaliatory steps and thus label it a "bellicose country" and justify Washington's military moves.
					
					 But the U.S. is seriously mistaken.
					
					 The U.S. arms buildup in the Asia-Pacific region and joint military exercises are not justified but facing an unprecedentedly open rebuff of countries in the region.
					
					 Moreover, the DPRK is not such a country which may allow itself to make even a slight concession or seek any lucky chance over the fundamental issue related to the security of the country and the nation for fear of the nonsensical label of "bellicose country."
					
					 It is the policy stand of the DPRK to redouble the efforts to bolster up justifiable deterrence for self-defence in every way to resolutely counter the U.S. hostile action.
					
					 If the U.S. seeks hegemony in the Asia-Pacific region as now and continues working hard to infringe upon the interests of the DPRK under this pretext, this will bring adverse consequences to the U.S. itself in the long run.
					
					 The U.S. reckless moves will have a very negative impact on resuming the six-party talks and realizing the denuclearization of the Korean peninsula for the present and, moreover, inevitably spark a nuclear arms race in the whole region.
					
					 The nuclear arms race in Northeast Asia which will prove more destructive than the nuclear issue in Mid-east is bound to end up making a mess of the initiative for building a "world without nuclear weapons" advocated by Obama.
					
					 The Obama administration would be well advised to coolly examine its hostile policy toward the DPRK whether it is in the final interests of the U.S., in actuality, when there is still time for it.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Songdowon International Children's Camp
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Songdowon International Children's Camp
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, visited the Songdowon International Children's Camp where its remodeling project is near completion.
					 He went round several places of the camp for hours to learn in detail about the project.
					
					 He watched the newly erected statues depicting President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il among children and then moved to the International Friendship Children's Hall.
					
					 Making the rounds of the theatre, mountaineering knowledge dissemination room, video games room, library, international friendship room, room for the Children's Union, drawing room, exhibition room for children's works, 4-D simulation cinema and other places of the hall one by one, he said he was very pleased to visit them. "Our architecture has successfully reached the world level," he said with pride.
					
					 Recalling that the Party gave an instruction to build a room dedicated to the education in Kim Jong Il's patriotism for implanting patriotism in children, he noted that the Party's intention was translated into a reality in the course of remodeling the camp.
					
					 Watching the slogan "We are the happiest in the world!" displayed in the compound of the camp, he said the slogan was very good, adding that it clearly reflected the gratitude of the children in the DPRK to the President and Kim Jong Il and to the Party for projecting them as the king of the country and loving them.
					
					 "We are struggling, regarding our trouble as pleasure, in order to enable our children and people to live with nothing to desire more in the world and the slogan helps us undertake any difficult job with pleasure," he said.
					
					 He highly appreciated the newly-built outdoor playground, gymnasium, indoor swimming pool and water park and archery field, noting that synthetic grass, spectators' seats and wave-style blue roof of the playground were in good harmony and all buildings looked like a beautiful picture and an art work.
					
					 He said that the aquarium, aviary and show room for stuffed specimens of animals were built in a peculiar style so that the campers might acquire knowledge about fauna and flora, adding they would like them.
					
					  Saying that not only bedrooms, dining halls and kitchens but service facilities of the first and second buildings were suited to the children's minds, he said cooking practice room was built well as intended by the Party so that children might enjoy cooking themselves and prepare varieties of dishes.
					
					 He noted with great satisfaction that all buildings and facilities of the camp meet the needs of the highly civilized socialist state in terms of their scale, style and contents and, at the same time, the national character is preserved in all aspects and the principle of convenience and architectural beauty first is abided by as required by the Juche-based idea of architectural beauty. "All buildings look beautiful as they reflect the Party's outlook on the rising generation and the camp looks like the best hotel and palace for children in the world," he added.
					
					 "The camp has been successfully remodeled to match the scenic beauty of the area near the picturesque Songdowon in the East Sea", he noted, emphasizing that this would be unthinkable without the sweat shed by soldier-builders of Unit 267 of  the Korean People's Army with loyalty. He highly praised the soldier-builders and officials of the relevant field for making great contributions to creating one more precious asset to be handed over to the generations to come.
					
					 He said: "There were bottlenecks and difficulties in the course of remodeling the camp but the trouble taken by us proved fruitful, one year hardworking would help the country make a decade of progress. How gratifying it is to watch the camp remodeled this way. We make a revolution to see such fruit".
					
					 He called for giving good finishing touches to the project and holding a ceremony of its completion with splendor as it was remodeled as required by the Party so that happy laughter and cheerful singing of children might be heard from the camp.
					
					 He was accompanied by Jang Jong Nam, So Hong Chan, Han Kwang Sang, Hwang Pyong So and Ma Won Chu

articles.title: CPRK Spokesman Blasts S. Korean Puppet Forces' Anti-DPRK Human Rights Campaign
articles.content:
CPRK Spokesman Blasts S. Korean Puppet Forces' Anti-DPRK Human Rights Campaign 
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet forces plan to set up in south Korea a hideous anti-DPRK plot-breeding organization called the UN "Office for Human Rights in North".
					 The puppet first vice-minister of Foreign Affairs said at the "National Assembly" Committee for Diplomacy and Unification that "he conveyed to the UN the point that south Korea has a willingness to house 'Office for Human Rights in North'" and a spokesman for the Foreign Ministry also clamored for "actively examining" the issue of setting up the office.
					
					 The coteries of the "Saenuri Party" staged the farce of making public a "joint statement" demanding the establishment of the UN "Office for Human Rights in North" and 17 conservative and reactionary organizations including the Citizens' Solidarity for Human Rights in North and wicked conservative media are kicking up a row, calling for taking measures for setting up the office.
					
					 A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea (CPRK) in an answer given to a question put by KCNA Monday denounced this as another intolerable hideous politically-motivated provocation against the DPRK and a height of confrontation hysteria.
					
					 The spokesman continued:
					
					 By origin, the farce of setting up the UN "Office for Human Rights" was staged by the U.S. to interfere in the internal affairs of other countries and bring down their social systems only to be bitterly censured by public in various countries for its illegal and provocative nature.
					
					 The U.S. has malignantly slandered for no reason the DPRK in which the genuine life of the popular masses is ensured at the highest level by law and institutional mechanisms and kicked up a human rights campaign against it. Not content with this, the U.S. is working hard to set up the above-said office. However, various countries are opposed to its move, voicing objection to south Korea's offer to host the office.
					
					 No wonder, the preceding regimes of south Korea which had been keen on kicking up a human rights campaign against the DPRK, pursuant to the U.S., dared not raise the issue of setting up in south Korea the UN "Office for Human Rights in North".
					
					 The desperate bid made by the puppet forces to set up such office is aimed at building an international center for anti-DPRK human rights campaign in south Korea in a bid to escalate the campaign as their sinister scenario is no longer workable on anyone. It is designed to ratchet up their provocative racket to hurt the dignity and the social system in the DPRK.
					
					 This bid was also prompted by their sinister plot to put pressure on progressive and democratic forces including the opposition parties in an effort to railroad the "Bill on Human Rights in North" through the puppet NA come what may and use it in favor of the "elections to local self-governing bodies" due in June.
					
					 In case the puppet forces persist in their moves to set up the office despite the warnings of the DPRK and the denunciation by all Koreans, the DPRK will regard it as a hideous provocation insulting and mocking at its people and social system and as a declaration of a war against the social systems and force the provokers to pay a dear price for it.
					
					 The puppet forces should ponder over the catastrophic consequences to be entailed by their frantic anti-DPRK human rights campaign and immediately stop the foolish farce.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Delegation of Koreans in Japan
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Delegation of Koreans in Japan
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, had a talk with the delegation of Koreans in Japan for celebrating the Day of the Sun (birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung) headed by Ri Ki Sok, advisor to the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Statue, Grave of Kang Pan Sok
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Statue, Grave of Kang Pan Sok
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid before the statue of Kang Pan Sok, an indomitable revolutionary fighter and outstanding leader of the Korean women's movement, at the Chilgol Revolutionary Site and her grave in Mangyongdae on Monday, her 122nd birth anniversary.
					 Seen standing before the statue and grave were wreaths sent by Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremonies were Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Yang Hyong Sop, Kang Sok Ju, Vice-Premier Ri Mu Yong, Chairman of the C.C., the Korean Social Democratic Party Kim Yong Dae, officials of the party and power bodies, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions and those in the educational field, service personnel of the KPA and other people in the city.
					
					 Wreaths were laid before the statue and grave in name of the C.C., the WPK, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK and the DPRK Cabinet.
					
					 Wreaths were also laid in the name of working people's organizations, ministries, national institutions, military academies, educational institutions, revolutionary schools and party and power bodies and farms in the city.
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of the revolutionary life and feats of Kang Pan Sok.

Senator from British Labor Party Here
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Neil Forbes Davidson, senator from the British Labor Party, and his companion arrived here on Monday.

Sakhalin Regional Government Delegation of Russia Arrives
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Sakhalin Regional Government of Russia led by Gakh Elena Nikolayevna, deputy minister of Economic Development, arrived here on Monday.

articles.title: WPK Delegation Leaves for Bangladesh
articles.content:
WPK Delegation Leaves for Bangladesh
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea led by Ri Chang Gun, vice department director of the C.C., the WPK,  left here Monday to participate in the 9th Congress of the Workers' Party of Bangladesh.

articles.title: 16th Kimilsungia Festival Closes
articles.content:
16th Kimilsungia Festival Closes
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The 16th Kimilsungia Festival closed with due ceremony at the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition on Monday. It opened on April 13 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The venue of the festival where tens of thousands of flowers of the sun were displayed was visited by hundreds of thousands of service personnel, working people, school youth and children, overseas Koreans and foreign guests.
					
					 The festival which drew endless crowd of visitors every day clearly reflected the firm resolution of the service personnel and people of the DPRK to successfully carry forward and accomplish the revolutionary cause of the peerlessly great men.
					
					 Present at the closing ceremony were Kim Ki Nam, Yang Hyong Sop and officials concerned, officials of the armed forces and power bodies, ministries and national institutions, service personnel, working people, school youth and children in the city and overseas Koreans.
					
					 Present there on invitation were Nasri Gustaman, Indonesian ambassador to the DPRK, and foreign guests.
					
					 Diplomas of the Kimilsungia Festival were awarded to units and former unconverted long-term prisoners who were highly estimated at the festival.
					
					 They were also conferred on the Indonesian embassy here, the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, foreigners and overseas Koreans.
					
					 Certificates of the participation in the festival went to many units and participants.
					
					 Kim Chang Do, chairman of the Korea Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Committee, made a closing address.

articles.title: Musanryong Spring Water Factory Built
articles.content:
Musanryong Spring Water Factory Built
 Puryong, April 21 (KCNA) -- The Musanryong Spring Water Factory has been built in Puryong County, North Hamgyong Province.
					 Musanryong spring water is the mineral water gushing out from hundreds of meters deep on the hillside of Musan Pass. The water very good in quality and containing varieties of mineral matters is good for digestion and efficacious for treating  hypertensive, urinary and other diseases.
					
					 Its taste and composition can be preserved for a long time.
					
					 The factory has a modern bottle production process, spring water production process equipped with filtering and sterilizing devices and a packing process.
					
					 It is increasing spring water production for customers in Puryong County and Chongjin City.

articles.title: New Kind of Bio-fertilizer Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
New Kind of Bio-fertilizer Developed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The State Bacilli-Culture Institute under the State Academy of Sciences in the DPRK has made four-element compound microorganism fertilizer to raise the agricultural production.
					 The bio-fertilizer, made of useful microbes inhabiting near the roots of crops, has already been applied to many rice paddies and maize fields, proving its effect.
					
					 Contained in it are nitrogen, phosphor, potassium and silicon bacteria, which help produce physiological activators and promote the growth of roots.
					
					 The fertilizer raises the content of nutriments in soil and improves the quality of agricultural products.
					
					 It is also applicable to the cultivation of flowers.

articles.title: First Round of Premier Soccer League Matches Closes
articles.content:
First Round of Premier Soccer League Matches Closes
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The first round of the premier soccer league matches of the Mangyongdae Prize Sports Contest closed in the DPRK. 
					 Rimyongsu, April 25, Amnokgang, Sobaeksu and Hwoebul teams in the men's matches while April 25, Sobaeksu, Mangyongbong, Rimyongsu and Wolmido teams in the women's matches proved successful. 
					
					 The second round of the matches will start soon.

articles.title: Goshawk, National Bird of Korea
articles.content:
Goshawk, National Bird of Korea
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Goshawk is the national bird in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 This seasonal bird breeds in tablelands around Mt. Paektu and Ryanggang, Jagang and South Hamgyong provinces of Korea and, in winter, moves even into the area south of the central part of the country.
					
					 It has a short and curved beak, with spindle legs, and its feathers are dark brown in general.
					
					 Goshawk's breeding takes place in late April to early May. It makes a nest on a high tree to lay three to four light blue eggs at a litter. The hatching period is 28-30 days and the weight of a chick is about 25g.
					
					 Goshawk takes mainly rodents and pheasant, pigeon and other birds as its prey while living in forests of needle-leaf and broadleaf trees.
					
					 From olden times, the Korean people have used goshawk to hunt such animals as pheasant, pigeon and hare.

articles.title: Ceremony for Laying Floral Basket Held in Russia
articles.content:
Ceremony for Laying Floral Basket Held in Russia
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- A ceremony for laying a floral basket before the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and a photo of supreme leader Kim Jong Un took place at the 11th Middle School in Khabarovsk City of Russia on April 15.
					 The participants laid a floral basket before the portraits and the photo at the classroom of the Russia-Korea Children's Friendship Association Named after Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them.
					
					 Ludmila Levkova, principal of the school, said:
					
					 The Day of the Sun (birth anniversary of Kim Il Sung) is the supreme national holiday of the Korean people.
					
					 Kim Il Sung will live forever as the sun.
					
					 Kim Jong Un, who is carrying forward the idea and cause of the preceding leaders, has energetically conducted activities to make the Korean people with nothing more to desire in the world.
					
					 The principal expressed the will to operate the classroom effectively to make pupils know better about the great leaders, history, culture and reality of the DPRK and contribute to developing the friendly relations between the two countries.

articles.title: S. Korean IS's Fabrication of Spy Case Assailed
articles.content:
S. Korean IS's Fabrication of Spy Case Assailed
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The south Korean prosecution made public the final results of investigation into the fabrication of evidence for the spy case of a public official in Seoul.
					 The results proved that the "convincing evidence" which the Intelligence Service presented as regards the recent case was sheer fabrication packaged with lies and conspiracies.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday in a commentary says the fabrication of the evidence for the spy case is a repetition of the shuddering crimes committed by the Central Intelligence Agency ill- famed as a despicable fascist plot-breeding tool during the "yusin" dictatorial rule.
					
					 The fabrication of the spy case by the hooligans of the IS is aimed to instill extreme hostility towards the DPRK into the south Korean society, chill the atmosphere for the improvement of the north-south ties and, at the same time, label the people's anti-"government" struggle "one following the north" and mercilessly suppress it under that pretext, the paper says, and goes on:
					
					 What matters is that the architects of the unpardonable conspiratorial cases have not been held responsible for the crimes at all.
					
					 The prosecution authorities' farce of making public the final results of investigation is an intolerable mockery of the public and an open connivance at the fascist tricksters.
					
					 The puppet chief executive is entirely to blame for the recent case.
					
					 It is as clear as noonday that the coteries of the Intelligence Service backed and supported by the chief executive will become all the more undisguised in their moves to bring the north-south ties to collapse  and crack down on the progressive forces.
					
					 No one can vouch that the election to local self-governing bodies due in June will not be a rigged one with all power bodies including the IS involved just as what happened during the previous "presidential" election.

articles.title: S. Korean Opposition Parties Demand Resignation of IS Director
articles.content:
S. Korean Opposition Parties Demand Resignation of IS Director
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- South Korean opposition parties demanded the resignation of the director of the Intelligence Service, according to MBC and CBS of south Korea.
					 The Alliance for New Politics and Democracy held a lawmakers' meeting on April 15 and adopted a resolution calling for ousting Nam Jae Jun, director of the IS, from his office.
					
					 It asserted that Nam has already lost the qualifications as the head of the IS.
					
					 The spy case of a pubic official in Seoul city should not be allowed to end in making an "apology", it said, urging Park Geun Hye to oust Nam Jae Jun from his office and opt for an overall reform of the IS.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The prosecution announced the results of the investigation that the upper echelon is not involved in the IS's fabrication of the spy case.  This is little short of pulling out only feathers of a bird, leaving its body untouched.
					
					 The Alliance for New Politics and Democracy called for introducing a special investigation into the case.
					
					 The Justice Party held that the first button for reforming the IS is to force Nam Jae Jun to step down at once.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Off Press in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Off Press in Russia
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung's work "Let Us Uphold Independence" was brought out in booklet by the Russian Association for Development of Friendship and Cooperation with Foreign Countries on April 15.
					  The work, made public on September 7, Juche 70 (1981), clarifies that it is the requirement of the present era to maintain independence in the activities of the party and the state and the Juche idea is a man-centered philosophy.

articles.title: Advantages of Juche Idea Introduced by Swiss Organizations
articles.content:
Advantages of Juche Idea Introduced by Swiss Organizations
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The Swiss preparatory committee for celebrating the Day of the Sun (birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung), the Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea made public a joint statement on April 12 on the occasion of his 102nd birth anniversary.
					 The statement said:
					
					 Kim Il Sung founded the immortal Juche idea and built a socialist land of bliss in the DPRK based on it.
					
					 That is why the number of the Juche idea followers is increasing worldwide day by day.
					
					 The Juche idea and the Songun idea founded by the President serve as the undying banner for realizing human emancipation and global indepenedence.
					
					 The President was the greatest and distinguished head of state.
					
					 The DPRK built by him has advanced despite any storm and challenge.
					
					 It stood as a beacon of socialism when socialism collapsed in the Soviet Union and East European countries.
					
					 This clearly proves the advantages of the Juche idea and the Songun idea.
					
					 Socialist Korea would resolutely foil all aggression moves of the U.S. and other imperialists and their counter-revolutionary intrigues.
					
					 No force dares provoke dignified Kim Il Sung's and Kim Jong Il's Korea.

articles.title: Day of Sun Celebrated in Different Countries
articles.content:
Day of Sun Celebrated in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries to celebrate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (Day of the Sun).
					 They included meetings and round-table talks in Iceland, Indonesia, Angola and South Africa between April 3 and 12.
					
					 Present there were personages of different circles and masses in relevant countries.
					
					 The general secretary of the Iceland-DPRK Friendship and Cultural Society praised Kim Il Sung for founding the immortal Juche idea and making great contributions to the Korean revolution and the cause of global independence through his energetic leadership.
					
					 The exploits performed by him on behalf of the times and history will be everlasting, the general secretary stressed.
					
					 The director of an Indonesian company praised Kim Il Sung as the great leader who turned the DPRK into a socialist power.
					
					 There is no such a great man in the world as Kim Il Sung who dedicated his whole life to the people's happiness and the accomplishment of the cause of global independence, the director noted.
					
					 The secretary of the Mfumalanga Provincial Committee of the South African Communist Party and other personages lauded the sacred revolutionary career of the President and the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un who is fully demonstrating the might of the DPRK before the world.

articles.title: Day of Sun Celebrated by Koreans in China
articles.content:
Day of Sun Celebrated by Koreans in China
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The General Association of Koreans in China held an event at Yuwen Middle School in Jilin, China on April 15 on the occasion of the 102nd birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (Day of the Sun).
					 Present there were Choe Un Bok, chairperson of the General Association of Koreans in China, officials of the association, delegates of its affiliated organizations, Korean nationals in Jilin city, officials of the DPRK consulate general in Shenyang, a vice-director of the Foreign Affairs Office of the Jilin Provincial People's Government, a vice-mayor of the Jilin City People's Government and others.
					
					 The participants laid floral baskets before the statue of Kim Il Sung at Yuwen Middle School in Jilin in the name of the association and its affiliated organizations and the DPRK consulate general in Shenyang and paid tribute to him.
					
					 A meeting of the association took place to celebrate his 102nd birth anniversary.
					
					 Choe Un Bok in a report praised Kim Il Sung as a legendary hero who saved and glorified the destiny of the country and nation by defeating the two imperialisms in one generation.
					
					 Choe called for turning out as one on the road of patriotism for glorifying the new century of Kim Il Sung's and Kim Jong Il's Korea as the one of prosperity and proud victory, rallied close around Marshal Kim Jong Un, in order to achieve the final victory of the revolutionary cause of Juche and the socialist cause pioneered and led by Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting.
					
					 A Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia show and a photo and book exhibition on the theme "Comrade Kim Il Sung's exploits will be everlasting" were held on the same day. There also took place an art performance and sports and amusement games.
					
					 The Zhongnan Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China held a meeting at the DPRK embassy in Beijing on April 12 and the Liaoning Regional Association of the association sponsored a meeting in Shenyang, China on April 13 on the same occasion.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Hong Wan Thae
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Hong Wan Thae
						
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un sent a wreath on April 19 to the bier of Dr. Hong Wan Thae, winner of Kim Il Sung Prize, Labor Hero, People's Scientist, Academician and Professor, expressing deep condolences over his death.
					 Hong was a researcher at Jongju Institute of Biomedicine for Poultry.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Off Press in Libya
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Off Press in Libya
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "The Great Kim Il Sung Is the Eternal Leader of Our Party and Our People" was brought out in pamphlet by the Amal Awail Publishing House, Libya, on April 15.
					 The work, made public on April 20, Juche 101 (2012), clarifies the revolutionary exploits President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il performed in their lifetimes. It indicates the tasks for firmly defending and eternally glorifying their ideas and exploits.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recorre Campamento Internacional de Ninos de Songdowon
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recorre Campamento Internacional de Ninos de Songdowon
 Pyongyang, 21 de abril (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, visito el Campamento Internacional de Ninos de Songdowon en visperas de su inauguracion.
					 El Mariscal analizo de modo concreto el estado de reconstruccion recorriendo varios lugares del campamento durante largo tiempo.
					
					 Estuvo ante las estatuas de bronce de los Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il estando entre los ninos, erguidas nuevamente en el campamento y se dirigio a la Casa de Ninos de Amistad Internacional.
					
					 Dando revista uno tras otro al teatro, las salas de difusion de conocimientos de alpinismo, de recreacion electronica, de amistad internacional, de Organizacion de Ninos, de bellas artes y de exhibicion de habilidades, la biblioteca, el cine de ritmo tridimensional, etc. dijo lleno de alegria que nuestra arquitectura alcanzo dignamente el nivel de talla mundial.
					
					 Anadio que el Partido dio ya instruccion de edificar la sala de educacion en el patriotismo de Kim Jong Il para infundir el espiritu  patriotico en cada corazon de los ninos, y esta vez tal proposito fue realizado con la reconstruccion el Campamento Internacional de Ninos de Songdowon.
					
					 Al ver la consigna "No envidiamos nada a nadie en el mundo" instalada en el recinto del campamento, destaco que esta es la cancion de nuestros ninos que expresan su gratitud a los  Generalisimos y a nuestro partido que aman a los ninos presentandolos como reyes del pais.
					
					 Trabajamos duramente para que nuestros ninos y habitantes vivan sin envidiar nada a nadie en el mundo, senalo y apunto que al ver esa consigna cumple con mucho gusto la labor tan dificil.
					
					 Alabo que se construyeron muy bien el campo deportivo al aire libre, el gimnasio bajo techo, la piscina bajo techo, la piscina al aire libre y el campo de tiro al arco al aire libre y destaco que se componen de manera armoniosa el cesped artificial del patio, las sillas de graderia y el tejadillo azul en forma de ondas y que todas las construcciones parecen un dibujo hermoso y una obra artistica.
					
					 Se puso muy alegre diciendo que se construyeron con peculiaridad el acuario, la pajarera y la sala de exhibicion de animales disecados para que los campistas asimilen los conocimientos sobre la fauna y la flora y los ninos gustaran al verlos.
					
					 No solo los dormitorios, el restaurante y la cocina de los albergues No.1 y 2 sino que tambien los establecimientos de servicio publico fueron construidos conforme a la psicologia infantil y preparados bien la sala de practica culinaria para que los ninos puedan cocinar varios platos con sus propias manos, menciono.
					
					 Expreso gran satisfaccion de que todas las edificaciones y los establecimientos fueron construidos conforme a la figura del pais civilizado socialista tanto en su dimension como en la forma y el contenido y fue asegurado a nuestro estilo el principio de comodidad primero y estetica primero segun la idea autoctona sobre la estetica arquitectonica. Y dijo que este campamento es un edificio excelente penetrado por la concepcion del partido sobre las generaciones venideras y es el hotel y el palacio de los ninos, unico en el mundo.
					
					 El Mariscal apunto que al margen del sudor de fidelidad de los constructores militares de la unidad 267 del EPC es inimaginable la reconstruccion exitosa del campamento que sienta bien con el paisaje periferico de Songdowon, lugar pintoresco del Mar Este de Corea, y aprecio mucho las proezas de los constructores militares y los funcionarios de referentes ramas quienes hicieron gran aporte a preparar nueva riqueza preciosa para las futuras generaciones.
					
					 Aunque hubo obstaculos y dificultades en la obra, vale la pena el esfuerzo, dijo y agrego que si nosotros sufrimos un ano, la patria se desarrolla 10 anos mas, lo cual es el valor de la revolucion.
					
					 Una vez reconstruido en el nivel definido por el Partido el Campamento Internacional de Ninos de Songdowon, hay que dar un buen acabado y realizar con solemnidad la ceremonia inaugural para que resuenen las risotadas y canciones felices de los ninos, instruyo.
					
					 Le acompanaron en la ocasion Jang Jong Nam, So Hong Chan, Han Kwang Sang, Hwang Pyong So y Ma Won Chun.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con delegacion de coreanos residentes en Japon
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con delegacion de coreanos residentes en Japon
 Pyongyang, 21 de abril (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, departio el dia 21 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con la delegacion de coreanos residentes en Japon encabezada por el asesor del Presidium del Comite Central de la Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon (Chongryon), Ri Ki Sok, que realiza una visita a la patria para celebrar el Dia del Sol (dia de nacimiento del Presidente Kim Il Sung).

articles.title: Clausurado XVI Festival de Kimilsungias
articles.content:
Clausurado XVI Festival de Kimilsungias
 Pyongyang, 21 de abril (ACNC) -- Quedo clausurado el XVI Festival de Kimilsungias  iniciado el dia 13 con motivo del Dia del Sol (dia de natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung).
					 Cientos de miles de militares, trabajadores, jovenes y ninos escolares, coreanos residentes en ultramar y huespedes extranjeros visitaron la sede del festival. 
					
					 El certamen demostro bien la voluntad del ejercito y pueblo coreanos de llevar adelante la causa revolucionaria de los grandes hombres sin iguales. 
					
					 Tuvo lugar este lunes la ceremonia de clausura en la Exposicion Permanente de Kimilsungia y Kimjongilia con la participacion de Kim Ki Nam, Yang Hyong Sop, los funcionarios correspondientes, los funcionarios de los organismos de las fuerzas armadas y el poder, ministerios y organos centrales, los militares, trabajadores, jovenes y ninos escolares de esta capital y los compatriotas en ultramar. 
					
					 Fueron invitados el embajador indonesio en Corea Nasri Gustaman y otros huespedes extranjeros. 
					
					 Fue otorgado el diploma del festival de Kimilsungias a las unidades sobresalientes, los ex presos de largas condenas no abjurados,  la embajada de Indonesia en Corea, el Presidium del Comite Central de la Chongryon (Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon), los huespedes extranjeros y los coreanos residentes en ultramar.
					
					 Muchas unidades y participantes recibieron el certificado de participacion.
					
					 El presidente del Comite de Kimilsungia y Kimjongilia de Corea, Kim Chang Do, hizo uso de la palabra de clausura.

articles.title: Terminada primera ronda de liga de futbol de categoria A
articles.content:
Terminada primera ronda de liga de futbol de categoria A
 Pyongyang, 21 de abril (ACNC) -- Quedo terminada la primera ronda de la liga de futbol de categoria A del Torneo Deportivo por el Premio Mangyongdae.
					 En el torneo masculino registraron buenas notas los equipos Rimyongsu, 25 de Abril, Amnokgang, Sobaeksu y Hwaebul, y en el femenino, los equipos 25 de Abril, Sobaeksu, Mangyongbong, Rimyongsu y Wolmido.
					
					 Tendra lugar pronto la segunda ronda de los partidos de categoria A del citado torneo.
